title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in Fort Collins

content.rendered:
Are you experiencing an urge to move? Or maybe you’re looking for universities and are keen to learn about life off-campus. With Roomi you can find cheap rooms for rent in Fort Collins, CO, as well as information on the average rent rates in the city. You’ll also discover the city’s lifestyle, public transportation, and weather, to help you out when considering a move. Whatever your situation, you’ll learn everything you need to know about Fort Collins in our handy guide below.

Getting to know Fort Collins

Located in the west of the US, in Colorado, the city of Fort Collins is Larimer County’s most populated municipality. Approximately 65 miles from the state capital Denver, Colorado, and 45 miles south of Cheyenne, Wyoming, Fort Collins sits at the base of the Rocky Mountain foothills.

Its economy is a mix of service-related businesses and assembling. An outdoorsy, mid-sized, dynamic city, Fort Collins is surrounded by snow-capped mountains, clear rivers, and natural lakes.

Known for its 300-days of year-round sunshine, summers here are mild to hot, with July being the warmest. Moreover, winters are mild to moderately cold, with December being the coldest. Additionally, if you love the idea of a winter wonderland, early September through to the end of May is snow time!

Finding rooms for rent in Fort Collins, Colorado

Find A Room For Rent In Fort Collins

Finding cheap rooms for rent in Fort Collins should not be mighty challenging. CSU offers off-campus provisions for international and national students alike, or you can choose to rent privately.

Furthermore, a developing hi-tech agricultural center, Fort Collins is segregated into five neighborhoods — downtown, north, south, east, and west. This is an equally suitable city for working young adults and professionals who enjoy the outdoors and adventurous activities.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Colorado Springs

Top neighborhoods in Fort Collins

  • Downtown and Old Town: The city center is full of all things effervescent and urban. The Downtown neighborhood is the city’s heart, with a vibrant art, food, and nightlife scene. It’s also a great place to find cheap rooms for rent in Fort Collins, particularly if you’re a student.
  • University Park: As the name suggests, this neighborhood is close to CSU and links college life to the suburbs. It’s also perfect for walking or cycling to the bustling attractions downtown.
  • South Fort Collins:  There are many new developments and excellent shopping and dining options here. Furthermore, located in this neighborhood is Huntington Hill, known for its family-friendly feel, accessibility to the foothills, and great family entertainment. In fact, homes here are newer and many feature modern amenities.

Average rent in Fort Collins

There are several options to explore when looking for cheap rooms for rent in Fort Collins — communal, flat-share, living with a roommate(s). Rental homes, flats, apartments, even log cabins!

Related: Dorms Vs Apartments. What’s Right For You?

University life in Fort Collins

University life involves learning the amplitude of university work that will take most of your time, and socializing amongst new cultures, traditions, mindsets. Fort Collins is a delightful city for people who love the outdoors and crave a town with all the pros of city life but with a more friendly feel.

Living on-campus can be more expensive, as the price includes Wi-Fi, meal plans, furnishings, utilities, etc. Apartments, especially studio apartments, can be cheaper. However, you’ll still have to cover rent, meals, and utilities, unless you plan on sharing your space with a roommate.

Related: Looking for a roommate? Here are some qualities to look for!

Top Universities in Fort Collins

  • Colorado State University: One of the top, classified “R1: Doctoral Universities”.
  • Front Range Community College, Fort Collins Campus
  • Institute of Business & Medical Careers (IBMC)
  • University of Northern Colorado
  • Naropa University

How transit-friendly is Fort Collins

Fort Collins is very transit-friendly! For this reason, the city encourages alternative transportation, like cycling and using public transit, over driving.

1. Walk-ability

A very friendly walkable city. You can conveniently walk around the city and most errands can be accomplished on foot.

2. Roads/traffic

Rush hours are from 7:00 am to 9:00 am and 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm, so leave early if possible. At other times driving is smooth and easy.

3. Taxis

Taxis are available on call 24*7. A few taxi services available in Fort Collins are:

  • zTrip (formerly known as Fort Collins Yellow Cab) can be booked using the zTrip App, call via phone, hail on the street, or book on the website.
  • Pedicabs powered by cyclists are also available for tours if you’re after a unique way to travel!

4. Public Transportation

Fort Collins has excellent public transportation. With the Transfort city bus system, you can track your schedules, routes, late-night services, and much more. In addition, it has information on the MAX Bus Rapid Transit and FLEX regional bus route for traveling further afield.

5. Airports

Denver International Airport is the closest major airport to Fort Collins. By road, it is roughly 70 miles south of the city.

6. Cycling

This city is an award-winning bicycle-friendly town. Visitors, residents, and students who want to explore the city on a bicycle but don’t own their own, can rent one from the historic Fort Collins Bicycle Library.

Related: Creative Ways To Store A Bike In An Apartment

Cultural Activities in Fort Collins

Tour De Fat

The New Belgium Brewing Company hosts the annual Tour de Fat, which sees droves of people riding bikes dressed in costumes. Fort Collins was a non-alcoholic town until 1968 when Colorado State University students protested to end the prohibition. This brewing company was conceived to recall the company’s beginnings and celebrate the established cycling community in Fort Collins.

Tour De Farms

Running 35-40 miles, Tour De Farm is a half-a-day bicycle charity fundraiser ride held annually in Fort Collins. It begins and ends at the Farmer’s Market or a local brewery. It also features a mix of paved and gravel road rides and a few stops at local farms. Moreover, at each farm stop, there will be tastings and refreshments on offer, along with welcoming representatives or owners to greet you.

Shopping Centers in Fort Collins

The Shops at Foothills

The Shops at Foothills are a great place to meet friends and enjoy food, music, shopping, movies, and all things entertaining. So, whether you’re after the latest sales & promotions, looking to grab a bite to eat, or want to sit back and enjoy a movie at the Cinemark XD entertainment venue, there’s something for everyone to enjoy here.

  • Hours: Monday – Saturday: 10 am – 8 pm. Sunday: 11 am – 6 pm.

Front Range Village Shopping Center

Front Range Village is a distinctive shopping center that offers a mix of stores, eating establishments, and leisure venues, located in Southeast Fort Collins. Here you’ll also find jewelry & accessories, eyewear, footwear, entertainment & electronics, homeware, groceries, health & beauty stores, and much more.

  • Hours: Monday – Saturday: 10 am – 9 pm. Sunday: 11 am – 6 pm.

Related: 8 Secrets To Spending Less While Grocery Shopping

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find a room for rent in Fort Collins? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we’ll help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
